main event: On January 21, 1961, a witness reported seeing a stationary, glowing, metallic object in the sky over Akron, Ohio.
interesting points: The object was described as a circular or disc shape, approximately three times the size of a dime., The object remained motionless in the sky for the duration of the observation, which lasted around 15-20 minutes., The Air Force concluded that the object observed was likely a misidentified setting moon distorted by atmospheric conditions., The time of the observation closely aligned with the official moonset time., This sighting was reported by several witnesses, contributing to the investigation.
witness description: The witness described the object as being circular or disc-shaped and glowing, about the size of a dinner plate.
